page.title: 06FARMING AROUND GARTMORE
page.content: {Easterhill Farm}has 278 acres from Flanders Moss to Baad Springs Caravan Site. It is part of a larger farm complex owned by the Macfarlane Family growing barley, wheat and rough grazing. There are 200 Cross ewes and lambs, with 46 beef suckler cows and calves fed on ammonia-treated straw. 10 acres are set aside for Nature Conservation. {Gartartan Farm}has 300 acres from the R. Forth including land bought from the Gartmore House Estate. Mr Phillips and his son have sheep and about 300 beef cattle reared indoors. Barley and turnips are grown. Some land floods when the Forth overflows. {Freuchan Farm}has 72 acres west of Gartmore run by Mr & Mrs Brownlie with 50 ewes and 50 Hereford beef calves. Some barley, turnips and hay are grown. Freuchan is Gaelic for heather.
